snippet: The case of Ashraf Fayadh, who was sentenced to death on charges of apostasy, is one of several that have fueled comparisons between Saudi Arabia and the jihadists of the Islamic State.
abstract: Death sentence for Saudi Arabia-based artist, poet and curator Ashraf Fayadh is latest in season of harsh punishments for country's dissidents, provoking comparisons with Islamic States' adherence to Sharia law.
lead_paragraph: The case of Ashraf Fayadh, who was sentenced to death on charges of apostasy, is one of several that have fueled comparisons between Saudi Arabia and the jihadists of the Islamic State.

headline.main: Artist’s Death Sentence Follows a String of Harsh Punishments in Saudi Arabia
headline.print_headline: Saudi Artist’s Death Sentence Follows a String of Harsh Punishments

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
